user_interface
Class ErrorHandler

java.lang.Object
  user_interface.ErrorHandler

public class ErrorHandler
extends java.lang.Object

Class used to display the potential error messages, which may be caused by inappropriate user input.

Author:
Richard Walker

Method Summary
static void invalidBuy()
          Prints an error message that states that the ticket could not be bought at this point in time.
static void invalidDate()
          Prints an error message that states that the user tried to input an invalid date.
static void invalidFlight()
          Prints an error message that states the user tried to select an invalid flight.
static void invalidInput()
          Invalid input from the user.
static void invalidOption()
           
static void invalidPort()
          Prints an error message that states that the user tried to input an invalid airport.
static void invalidReturn()
           
static void invalidSort()
          Invalid sorting option.
static void invalidSortOrder()
          Invalid sorting order.
static void invalidTime()
          Invalid Time data.
static void notANum()
          Prints an error message that states that the user tried to input a non-numeric character for the date (day).
static void notYesOrNo()
          Prints an error message that states that the user did not type "Yes" or "No" for their answer.
static void samePort()
          Prints an error message that states that the departure airport can't be the same as the arrival.
static void whoops()
          Some error involving buying a flight occurred.
